communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Student Directory Information
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All directory information on all currently enrolled cadets at the Virginia Military Institute. The contact information of enrolled students (including their cell phone numbers and email addresses) is a matter of public record. Under FERPA, it is considered “directory information,” along with other basic information like the student’s email, major, dates of attendance and enrollment status. It is common for entities that want to advertise to students to request this publicly available contact information — everything from apartment complexes, to credit cards, to political candidates and so there is no exemption that will prevent release of this information unless individual cadets specifically sign a statement to have their information “withheld.” Under federal law, directory information is not considered private unless students opt to withhold it from public disclosure.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.
